summary: The State Department has a monitoring and evaluation contract to help it oversee over $4 billion of nonhumanitarian, nonmilitary U.S. assistance to Ukraine—such as training border guards and ensuring safe nuclear facilities. State has used some information produced under this contract for oversight and budgeting decisions, but not as much as expected. Challenges, such as data access and the difficulty of monitoring during wartime, have...
title: Ukraine: U.S. State Department Has Taken Steps to Enhance Monitoring and Evaluation of Assistance
